item.title: Diaries of Tom Turley - First entry
item.description: Mother was crying again. She tried to be quiet, but I heard. I will never get used to the sound. Why must she always be sad? She must have wed him for a reason. I wonder if they had it better before me. Father came to say goodnight. He sat on my bedside, telling me one of his stories. His gaze often left my face. I could see in his eyes, that he was dreaming of the sea.
